Job Title: Civil/Water Resources Engineer

Location: Folsom, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
This Jobot Job is hosted by: Brian Perkins

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $80,000 - $150,000 per year

A bit about us:

Engineering and environmental science consulting firm committed to investigating, analyzing, and solving complex environmental problems around the globe. Our work ranges from practical solutions for environmentally sound industrial operations and property development to toxicological analysis and management of chemical hazards, sustainable development of water and other natural resources, and protection of our rivers, bays, and estuaries.

Why join us?

 Strong pay package Fully paid for medical, dental and vision benefits Great company atmosphere Profit Sharing Quarterly bonuses Flexible scheduling

Job Details

Responsibilities:

Conduct hydrologic and hydraulic evaluations for stormwater runoff

Design stormwater treatment facilities, pump stations, and conveyance infrastructure

Conduct engineering feasibility analyses

Participate in research and development of innovative stormwater quality treatment techniques

Evaluate stormwater quality data, conduct industrial and construction site assessments, and develop/recommend stormwater best management practices to reduce pollutants in stormwater discharges

Prepare stormwater pollution prevention plans, exceedance response action plans, technical reports, and proposals

Provide permitting and compliance support to our clients

Contribute to a team atmosphere through collaboration with technical experts, project managers, colleagues, and subcontractors

Bachelor's degree or higher in engineering; Master's degree is preferred

Understanding of stormwater/wastewater regulations and related permit requirements

Engineering design experience

Demonstrated critical thinking, data analysis, and problem-solving skills

Ability to manage multiple tasks, work independently, and as part of a team

Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills

Excellent computer skills (MS Office Suite)

40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER certification a plus

Valid driver's license and clear driving record

Ability to travel domestically

Flexibility to work outside normal office work hours, if needed

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Civil/Water Resources Engineer

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
